dmca.title: Re: [TP-C182777U] Complaint: ilegal photo on a website
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Carlos Anibarro [mailto:cae@bolivia-internet.com] 
Posted At: Monday, July 31, 2006 7:54 PM
Posted To: Legal Response
Conversation: [TP-C182777U] Complaint: ilegal photo on a website
Subject: Re: [TP-C182777U] Complaint: ilegal photo on a website
Importance: High


Well

I wonder what really constitutes copyright infringement if you say this doesnt

They are using a photo of me, without any authorization from me, in a site full of
porn.

Im disappointed but well, I see nothing else can be done, no way to stop an abuser
who without any authorization at all uses one of my pictures in his porn site. Nice
i wonder what you would feel if someone does that with you.

Regards

_______________________________
Carlos Anibarro
Bolivia en Internet
mailto:cae@bolivia-internet.com
http://www.bolivia-internet.com

----- Original Message -----
From: "Legal Response" <LegalResponse@theplanet.com>
To: <cae@bolivia-internet.com>
Cc: <Theplanet@chillingeffects.org>
Sent: Monday, July 31, 2006 10:36
Subject: FW: [TP-C182777U] Complaint: ilegal photo on a website


> To Whom It May Concern:
>
> Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not 
> substantially comply with the required notification elements of the 
> Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").
>
> Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your 
> claim.
>
> Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
>
> Legal Response Team
> THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Carlos Anibarro [mailto:cae@bolivia-internet.com]
> Posted At: Sunday, July 23, 2006 4:57 PM
> Posted To: Legal Response
> Conversation: [TP-C182777U] Complaint: ilegal photo on a website
> Subject: Fw: [TP-C182777U] Complaint: ilegal photo on a website
> Importance: High
>
>
> Dear CEO
>
> I have been trying to reach the "copyright" department at theplanet.com 
> after i was redirected to them by the abuse@theplanet.com contact without 
> luck until today.
>
> There is a website, a XXX website from spain who has (regardless to say) 
> published a photo of me in their website without any authorization from 
> me.
>
> Probably they got that picture from my website or something.
>
> I have asked the webmaster of that site to remove the picture that appears 
> in this page:
> http://www.putalocura.com/variedades/bochornosas/192.html
> (im the one with glasses, at the bottom of the page) and i had no luck on 
> this either.
>
> I know oyu will understand how much this is bothering me. Im not a person 
> that surfs on this type of sites and im a grown and married man. I dont 
> want this to cause me any problems.
>
> Is there a way my photo can be pulled from that site and that this type of 
> abuse from people like the people that do this typ of websites can be 
> stoped? im referreing to the use of unauthorized photos and all that 
> stuff.
>
> Please? I will be looking forward for your answer
>
> Thanks in advance
>
> _______________________________
> Carlos Anibarro
> Bolivia en Internet
> mailto:cae@bolivia-internet.com
> http://www.bolivia-internet.com
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Carlos Anibarro" <cae@bolivia-internet.com>
> To: <copyright@theplanet.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, July 19, 2006 19:12
> Subject: Fw: [TP-C182777U] Complaint: ilegal photo on a website
>
>
>> Dear sirs
>>
>> 2 days ago i addressed this complaint to abuse@theplanet.com who
>> redirected me to you.
>>
>> The site "putalocura.com" hosted in this server:
>> 92.ca.5646.static.theplanet.com (70.86.202.146)
>>
>> has a photo of me on this url:
>> http://www.putalocura.com/variedades/bochornosas/192.html
>> Placed there without any authorization from myself.
>> Besides the fact this site has XXX info and nothing related to me, they
>> are offending myself with the ilgal use of this photograph
>>
>> I will appreciate this situation can be taken and my photograph can be
>> taken from that site.
>>
>> Kindly regards
>>
>> _______________________________
>> Carlos Anibarro
>> Bolivia en Internet
>> mailto:cae@bolivia-internet.com
>> http://www.bolivia-internet.com
>>
>> ----- Original Message ----- 
>> From: <abuse@theplanet.com>
>> To: <cae@bolivia-internet.com>
>> Sent: Monday, July 17, 2006 06:14
>> Subject: [TP-C182777U] Complaint: ilegal photo on a website
>>
>>
>>> Reference: [TP-C182777U]
>>>
>>> copyright@theplanet.com is the clearinghouse for all copyright
>>> infringement reports. Your email is being sent to our legal counsel at
>>> the address copyright@theplanet.com for consideration. You may find 
>>> their
>>> direct contact information at this URL:
>>> http://www.theplanet.com/legal/
>>> -- 
>>> Thank you,
>>>
>>> Policy Enforcement
>>> The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
>>> http://www.theplanet.com/legal/
>>>
>>> ==== Original Message ====
>>> 1. Complaint: ilegal photo on a website
>>> Added by system at Monday, Jul 17 2006 10:06 am
>>> X-MailFrom: cae@bolivia-internet.com
>>> X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com

>>> <abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com>; Mon Jul 17 10:06:21 2006

>>> Delivery-date: Mon, 17 Jul 2006 10:06:20 -0500

>>> by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from cae@bolivia-internet.com)
>>> with esmtp (Exim)
>>> id 1G2Ufs-0006ts-NP
>>> for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Mon, 17 Jul 2006 10:06:20 -0500

>>> smtp01.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830);
>>> Mon, 17 Jul 2006 10:06:19 -0500

>>> helo=mx01.filter.theplanet.com)
>>> by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from cae@bolivia-internet.com)
>>> with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256)
>>> (Exim)
>>> id 1G2Ufr-0000Uq-Me
>>> for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 17 Jul 2006 10:06:19 -0500

>>> by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from cae@bolivia-internet.com)
>>> with smtp (Exim)
>>> id 1G2Ttp-000NlY-8Q
>>> for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 17 Jul 2006 09:16:41 -0500
>>> Received: (qmail 32637 invoked by uid 0); 17 Jul 2006 13:11:46 -0000
>>> Received: from unknown (HELO box16.bluehost.com) (67.138.240.16)
>>>  by mailproxy2.bluehost.com with SMTP; 17 Jul 2006 13:11:46 -0000
>>> Received: from spock.caespock.org ([200.87.124.162] helo=spock)
>>> by box16.bluehost.com with esmtpa (Exim 4.52)
>>> id 1G2Ssu-00074C-Ip; Mon, 17 Jul 2006 07:11:41 -0600
>>> Message-ID: <001901c6a9a2$8acd6330$a27c57c8@caespock.org>
>>> From: "Carlos Anibarro" <cae@bolivia-internet.com>

>>> Content-Type: text/plain;
>>> format=flowed;
>>> charset="iso-8859-1";
>>> reply-type=response
>>> Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
>>> X-Priority: 3
>>> X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
>>> X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2900.2869
>>> X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.2869
>>> X-Identified-User:
>>> {32336:box16.bluehost.com:boliviai:bolivia-internet.com} {sentby:smtp
>>> auth 200.87.124.162 authed with cae@bolivia-internet.com}
>>> Received-SPF: pass (mx01.filter.theplanet.com: domain of
>>> bolivia-internet.com designates 70.103.189.17 as permitted sender)
>>> client-ip=70.103.189.17; envelope-from=cae@bolivia-internet.com;
>>> helo=outbound-mail-22.bluehost.com;
>>> X-OriginalArrivalTime: 17 Jul 2006 15:06:19.0880 (UTC)
>>> FILETIME=[8F392E80:01C6A9B2]
>>> Received-SPF: neutral (mx01.filter.theplanet.com: 70.87.6.110 is neither
>>> permitted nor denied by domain of bolivia-internet.com)
>>> client-ip=70.87.6.110; envelope-from=cae@bolivia-internet.com;
>>> helo=smtp01.theplanet.com;
>>>
>>> MIME element (text/plain)
>>> Dear sirs
>>>
>>> I was scared to death when a friend reported to me that a website, an 
>>> XXX
>>> website with discusting content waspublishing one of my photos.
>>> Regardless to say, this photo is 100% unauthorized and probably was
>>> copyed
>>> from one of my websites
>>> My picture appears here (im the one with the computer at the bottom):
>>> http://www.putalocura.com/variedades/bochornosas/192.html
>>> This "brazy bich"(putalocura) site runs on one of your servers:
>>> 92.ca.5646.static.theplanet.com (70.86.202.146)
>>>
>>> I have asked the webmaster a weekago to remove my picture with no reply
>>> at
>>> all, so im including below the new email i sent him this morning too.
>>>
>>> Is there any action it can be taken with this account/user? he is using
>>> my
>>> photo without any authorization, in a XXX site and all that, I know you
>>> can
>>> understand the implications.
>>>
>>> Thank you very much i will be looking forward for your answer
>>>
>>> Kindly regards
>>>
>>> _______________________________
>>> Carlos Anibarro
>>> Bolivia en Internet
>>> mailto:cae@bolivia-internet.com
>>> http://www.bolivia-internet.com
>>>
>>> ----- Original Message -----
>>> From: "Carlos Anibarro" <cae@bolivia-internet.com>
>>> To: <webmaster@putalocura.com>
>>> Sent: Monday, July 17, 2006 09:06
>>> Subject: Imagen no autorizada
>>>
>>>
>>>> Estimados seÃ±ores
>>>>
>>>> Un amigo me hizo referencia a esta pagina:
>>>> http://www.putalocura.com/variedades/bochornosas/192.html
>>>> en la que aparece mi foto de manera ilegal (con el computador)
>>>> Les agradecere mucho eliminar mi foto de ahi.
>>>>
>>>> Atentamente
>>>> _______________________________
>>>> Carlos Anibarro
>>>> Bolivia en Internet
>>>> mailto:cae@bolivia-internet.com
>>>> http://www.bolivia-internet.com
>>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>
>
>
